content:
There are three available folders-view settings: At the top of the Folders pane, to the right of the word Folders, the ... menu offers the All Folders option, and should cancel the Unified selection. In the menu bar, click View > hover over Folders, and click All. In the hamburger menu (3 horizontal bars, on the right in any message window), click View > Folders > All.

All three of those should show the All selection ticked.

If you have already tried all three of those with no success, c'mon back and we'll see whether there are other options.
creator: danawilson001

content: Iba pre gmail.com: Prihláste sa priamo z webu, či vám v gmail nenapísali, že vám zamietli možnost prihlásenia sa, a že prípadný útočník pozná vaše heslo, a že môžete znížiť zabezpečenie a potom že to pôjde. Takže problém môže byť aj vo vyššom zabezpečení na strane google.com. Stáva sa to vtedy, pokiaľ sa použije v krátkom čase pri prístupe k vášmu účtu viac prehliadačov alebo viac IP adries k prihláseniu. „Nedávno jsme zabránili pokusu o přihlášení do tohoto zařízení. Uvedli jste, že jste tento pokus provedli vy. Pro účely zabezpečení se toto zařízení bude po dobu dvou týdnů zobrazovat v seznamu. Zmíněnou událost můžete také prověřit na stránce“ = Preverte či mate vypnuté dvojstupňové overenie: https://myaccount.google.com/security?pli=1#signin a zapnite aj prístup pre menej bezpečné aplikácie: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps = A ešte preverte na webe, či ste si vo svojom účte povolili POP, alebo IMAP prístup: http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/Gmail_POP3_povoleny.jpg http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/gmail_IMPAP.jpg = 1. Odstránte z Thunderbirdu jestvujúci účet na gmail.com 2. Ukončite a znova spustite Thunderbird 3. Vytvorte NOVÝ (ten odstránený ) účet 4. Nechajte Thunderbird, aby automaticky vytvoril tento účet na gmail.com. Nijak neupravujte automaticky nastavený POP a SMTP prístup k účtu. Iba zadajte správne prístupové MENO a prístupové HESLO. 5. Potom by to malo fungovať.

content:
App passwords are usually only required if the the authentication method is restricted (by the provider or the mail app) to 'normal password', or 2-step verification is set on the account. With OAuth2 authentication, enter the account password, not an app password, when asked for a 'password'.

I suggest turning off the VPN and perhaps running Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps that might be interfering, especially antivirus.

content:
It's a menu icon. Clicking it opens a menu. It consists of three horizontal bars. It looks like the lines below, but the bars are much closer together. The name "hamburger" comes from the idea that it represents a bun (top and bottom lines) and a hamburger patty (middle line). There is one hamburger icon on every page of Thunderbird that can be opened by clicking the name of a folder in the folder pane. If you click Inbox, Drafts, Junk, or Trash, or any of the folders under Local Folders, you should see the hamburger icon way over on the right hand side of the page, near the top of the window.

content: The fact that you have multiple profiles indicates you have reinstalled several times, starting fresh apparently each time. So, over time, the problem escalates. The issue is rather simple when there is just one profile to fix. To reconstruct all of the mail folders, do as I posted previously. For example, you may see in a profile with a mail folder such as this: Mail\<accountname>\INBOX and Mail\<accountname>\INBOX.msf - those two go together. If you have multiple accounts, then you will likely see multiple message folders with the same name. So, my suggestion is to rename so that you will remember, such as accountnameINBOX and accountnameINBOX.msf - Then, when you copy to the Mail\Local Folders folder, they will be unique from other accounts. I agree it's rather a messy situation, but it has accumulated. Once done, I encourage doing a full backup.
creator: davidsk

creator: zwaartekracht2011

content:
On your question, no, you cannot put all profiles together. Instead, you must selective identify the desired folders and that must be done outside of Thunderbird. Those profiles you have may go back a long time, as Thunderbird never uses more than one. New profiles are automatically created whenever Thunderbird starts and does not 'see' an active profile. Each profile has a Mail folder and in each Mail folder are POP account folders, which each contain folders of messages. Also, each Mail folder has a Local Folders folder and there may be message folders there as well. Your challenge is to identify all of them, rename as appropriate to avoid duplication, and copy to the Mail\Local Folders folder of your active profile. That preserves all of your POP mail in local folders. You are now free to create all the missing accounts. After verifying that all is working, you can delete the other profiles.

One more thing: each profile as an addressbook named abook.sqlite. I suggest locating the largest or most recent and also copy that into the active profile.

If there are POP accounts, the folders in Mail\<accountname> can be copied into the new profile's Mail\Local folders folder (being appropriately renamed). i do not really understand what you mean: creating a profile is done in Thunderbird ? and moving all files in a single (Mail) file can only been done when Thunderbird is off ? can i just put all my profiles into one of them and then reinstalling Thunderbird again useing that profile ?

kind regards, JJ
creator: zwaartekracht2011

content: When TB is reinstalled, it is not unusual for an empty profile to be created. My suggestion is to browse the profiles in Windows file explorer to determine which have content. For example, the addressbook is abook.sqlite, and any POP accounts will be in the Mail folder, as well as any Local folders. Any IMAP accounts would be defined in the Imapmail folder. Once you know that, and the last date that folders were updated in each, you will have a better perspective on the value of each profile. For addressbook, I would search for the biggest and most recently updated one, as the tools>import feature can import it into a desired new profile. If there are POP accounts, the folders in Mail\<accountname> can be copied into the new profile's Mail\Local folders folder (being appropriately renamed).
creator: davidsk

creator: zwaartekracht2011

content: A profile includes a set of one or more email accounts and their messages and any local folders. You can activate each individually by clicking help>moretroubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles', click 'about:profiles' and then select a profile to activate.

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
david said
If there is a legal concern, I suggest including everything, as that shows the content of the email conversation at the time the recipient responded. Any cutting may corrupt the paper trail.

My way of including everything is to save to PDF all the individual emails. My concern is that each individual PDF printout contains quotes, when is not necessary because of my aforementioned method. Each individual email gets longer and longer because it contains the whole conversation up until that point (as long as both parties reply with quotes).

While I could find the last email in the chain and just save that to PDF, that won't contain any conversations that branched off between other parties, while my method does, because I am saving each individual email registered to that thread.
creator: gsrgtrdg4565653

content: If there is a legal concern, I suggest including everything, as that shows the content of the email conversation at the time the recipient responded. Any cutting may corrupt the paper trail.
